sen.j: 高瀬川（たかせがわ）は、江戸時代初期に角倉了以・角倉素庵父子によって、京都の中心部と伏見を結ぶために物流用に開削された運河である。
sen.e: The Takase-gawa River is a canal excavated by Ryoi SUMINOKURA and his son Soan SUMINOKURA in the early Edo Period for distribution of goods between the central Kyoto and Fushimi.
The Takase-gawa River is a canal excavated by Ryoi SUMINOKURA and his son Soan SUMINOKURA in the early Edo Period for distribution of goods between the central Kyoto and Fushimi.
The Takase-gawa River is a canal excavated by Ryoi SUMINOKURA and his son Soan SUMINOKURA in the early Edo period for distribution of goods between the central Kyoto and Fushimi.
sen.cmt: period 小文字にしました。

sen.j: 開削から大正9年（1920年）までの約300年間京都・伏見間の水運に用いられた。
sen.e: It was used for water transportation for about 300 years from this excavation until 1920.
From its excavation, the canal was used for 300 years as a means to transport goods over water until 1920.
From its excavation, the canal was used for 300 years as a means to transport goods over water until 1920.

sen.j: 現在は鴨川 (淀川水系)において京都側と伏見側で分断されており、上流側を高瀬川、下流側を東高瀬川、新高瀬川と呼ぶ。
sen.e: Today the Kamo-gawa River (Yodo-gawa River System) divides the Takase-gawa River into two; the Kyoto side section and Fushimi side section--the upstream side is called Takase-gawa Rive and the downstream side stream is called Shin-takase-gawa River or Shin-takase-gawa River.

Today the Kamo-gawa River (Yodo-gawa River System) divides the Takase-gawa River into two; the Kyoto side section and Fushimi side section--the upstream side is called Takase-gawa River and the downstream side is called Shin-takase-gawa River or Shin-takase-gawa River.

Today the Kamo-gawa River (Yodo-gawa River system) divides the Takase-gawa River into two; the Kyoto side section and Fushimi side section--the upstream side is called Takase-gawa River and the downstream side is called Higashi-takase-gawa River or Shin-takase-gawa River.
sen.cmt: 東高瀬川 としました。

sen.j: 京都中心部の三条から四条あたりにかけては京都の歓楽街の一つとなっており、またサクラの名所ともなっている。
sen.e: A basin of the river from the central Kyoto to Sanjo and Shijo is one of Kyoto's amusement area and a famous cherry blossom viewing spot.
The basin of the river from central Kyoto to Sanjo and Shijo is one of Kyoto's amusement areas and a famous cherry blossom viewing spot.
The basin of the river from central Kyoto to Sanjo and Shijo is one of Kyoto's amusement areas and a famous cherry blossom viewing spot.

sen.j: 高瀬川は、二条大橋の南で鴨川 (淀川水系)西岸を併走する「鴨川 (淀川水系)分流」（鴨川の分流）から取水する。
sen.e: The Takase-gawa River draws water from "a branch of the Kamo-gawa (Yodo-gawa River System) bunnryu" (a branch of the Kamo-gawa River).
The Takase-gawa River draws water from "a branch of the Kamo-gawa (Yodo-gawa River System) bunnryu" (a branch of the Kamo-gawa River).

The Takase-gawa River draws water from 'a branch of the Kamo-gawa (Yodo-gawa River system) bunryu' (a branch of the Kamo-gawa River) that runs side by side on the west bank of the Kamo-gawa River (Yodo-gawa River system) from the south of Nijo-ohashi Bridge.

sen.j: 二条から木屋町通沿いの西側を南下し、十条通の上流で鴨川に合流する。
sen.e: From Nijo it runs southward in the west side of the Kiyamachi-dori until it flows into the Kamo-gawa River above the Jujo-dori.
From Nijo it runs southward in the west side of the Kiyamachi-dori until it flows into the Kamo-gawa River above the Jujo-dori.
From Nijo it runs southward in the west side of the Kiyamachi-dori Street until it flows into the Kamo-gawa River above the Jujo-dori Street.

sen.j: かつて、京都と伏見を結ぶ運河であった頃は、現在の鴨川合流点のやや上流側で鴨川を東へ横断したのち、一部区間で竹田街道と並行、濠川と合流し伏見港を経て淀川に合流していた。
sen.e: When it was the canal that connected Kyoto and Fushimi, it crossed the Kamo-gawa River slightly above today's joint with the Kamo-gawa River, ran in parallel with the Takeda-kaido Road in some sections, joined with the Hori-kawa River, and then flowed into the Yodo-gawa River via Fushimi Port.

When it was a canal that connected Kyoto and Fushimi, it crossed the Kamo-gawa River slightly above today's joint with the Kamo-gawa River, running in parallel with the Takeda-kaido Road in some sections, joining with the Hori-kawa River, and then flowed into the Yodo-gawa River via Fushimi Port.

When it was a canal that connected Kyoto and Fushimi, it crossed the Kamo-gawa River eastward slightly above today's joint with the Kamo-gawa River, running in parallel with the Takeda-kaido Road in some sections, joining with the Hori-kawa River, and then flowed into the Yodo-gawa River via Fushimi Port.
sen.cmt: 東へ を追加しました。

sen.j: 現在、鴨川以南は東高瀬川と呼ばれ、上記高瀬川や鴨川とはつながっておらず、雨水等を水源とする河川となっている。
sen.e: Today the river south of the Kamo-gawa River is called Higashi-takase-gawa River, is not connected to the Takase-gawa River and the Kamo-gawa River, with its water sauce coming from rainwater.
Today the river south of the Kamo-gawa River is called Higashi-takase-gawa River, is not connected to the Takase-gawa River and the Kamo-gawa River, and is sourced from rainwater.
Today the river south of the Kamo-gawa River is called Higashi-takase-gawa River, is not connected to the Takase-gawa River and the Kamo-gawa River, and is sourced from rainwater.

sen.j: また、疏水放水路と合流して直接宇治川に流れ出ており、濠川とは合流していない。
sen.e: It also joins with drainage and directly flows into the Uji-gawa River without joining with Hori-kawa River.
It also joins with the drainage canal to directly flow into the Uji-gawa River without joining with Hori-kawa River.
It also joins with the drainage canal to directly flow into the Uji-gawa River without joining with Hori-kawa River.

sen.j: （東高瀬川において、宇治川に直接つなげるために整備された部分を新高瀬川と呼ぶこともある。）
sen.e: (In the Higashi-takase-gawa River, a section developed to directly connect the Uji-gawa River may be called the Shin-takase-gawa River.)
(The section in the developed Higashi-takase-gawa River which was developed to directly connect to the Uji-gawa River may be called the Shin-takase-gawa River.)
(The section in the Higashi-takase-gawa River which was developed to directly connect to the Uji-gawa River may be called the Shin-takase-gawa River.)
sen.cmt: developed を一箇所削除しました。

tit.cmt: 小タイトル用に変更しました。

sen.j: 京都府
sen.e: Kyoto Prefecture
Kyoto Prefecture
Kyoto Prefecture

sen.j: 京都市中京区、下京区、南区 (京都市)、伏見区
sen.e: Nakagyo Ward Kyoto City, Shimogyo Ward, Minami Ward (Kyoto City), Fushimi Ward
Nakagyo Ward Kyoto City, Shimogyo Ward, Minami Ward (Kyoto City), Fushimi Ward
Nakagyo Ward, Shimogyo Ward, Minami Ward (Kyoto City) and Fushimi Ward in Kyoto City
sen.cmt: 京都市 を移動しました。

sen.j: 慶長15年（1610年）、方広寺大仏殿の再建（一説には、徳川家康が豊臣家の資力を削減させるために行わせたとされている。
sen.e: In the building of Hoko-ji Temple Daibutsu-den Hall in 1610, (Ieyasu TOKUGAWA is said to have ordered Toyotomi family to reconstruct Hoko-ji Temple Daibutsu-den Hall with an intention of crippling the financial power of Toyotomi.)

In the building of Hoko-ji Temple Daibutsu-den Hall in 1610, (Ieyasu TOKUGAWA is said to have ordered the Toyotomi family to reconstruct Hoko-ji Temple Daibutsu-den Hall, with the intent of financially crippling the Toyotomis.)

In the building of Hoko-ji Temple Daibutsu-den Hall in 1610, (Ieyasu TOKUGAWA is said to have ordered the Toyotomi family to reconstruct Hoko-ji Temple Daibutsu-den Hall, with the intent of financially crippling the Toyotomis.)

sen.j: ）において、角倉了以・角倉素庵父子は鴨川を利用して資材運搬を行った。
sen.e: Ryoi SUMINOKURA and his son Soan SUMINOKURA used the Kamo-gawa River to transport construction materials.
Ryoi SUMINOKURA and his son Soan SUMINOKURA used the Kamo-gawa River to transport construction materials.
Ryoi SUMINOKURA and his son Soan SUMINOKURA used the Kamo-gawa River to transport construction materials.

sen.j: その後慶長19年（1614年）に、角倉了以・素庵父子によって、京都・伏見間の恒久的な運河が開鑿された。
sen.e: After this, Ryoi SUMINOKURA and his son Soan SUMINOKURA started to excavate the persisting canal between Kyoto and Fushimi.
After this, Ryoi SUMINOKURA and his son Soan SUMINOKURA started to excavate the canal between Kyoto and Fushimi.
Subsequently, Ryoi SUMINOKURA and his son Soan SUMINOKURA opened a permanent canal between Kyoto and Fushimi in 1614.
sen.cmt: 1614年には運河は完成していたようですので、左記のように変更しました。

sen.j: これが高瀬川である。
sen.e: The canal is the Takase-gawa River.
This canal was the Takase-gawa River.
This canal was the Takase-gawa River.

sen.j: 水深は数十センチメートル程度と浅く、物流には底が平らで喫水の少ない高瀬舟と呼ばれる小舟が用いられた。
sen.e: It is such a shallow canal--several tens of centimeters deep--that a small, floaty boat called Takasebune boat were used.
The canal was so shallow--several tens of centimeters deep--that small boats called Takasebune boat were used.
The canal was so shallow--several tens of centimeters deep--that small boats called Takasebune boat were used.

sen.j: 二条から四条に掛けては、荷物の上げ下ろしや船の方向転換をするための「船入」が高瀬川から西側に直角に突き出すように作られた。
sen.e: Between Nijo and Shijo, a Funairi was created in such a manner as it projected at a right angle for the purpose of loading and unlaoding of goods and doing a turnabout.

Between Nijo and Shijo, a Funairi was constructed such that it projected out at a right angle from the river in order to allow the loading and unloading of goods, as well as allowing boats to perform a U-turn.

Between Nijo and Shijo, a Funairi was constructed such that it projected out at a right angle toward from the river toward the west in order to allow the loading and unloading of goods, as well as allowing boats to perform a U-turn.
sen.cmt: 西側に を追加しました。

sen.j: （現在は、史跡指定されている「高瀬川一之船入」を除き、すべて埋め立てられている。）
sen.e: (Today the entire canal was reclaimed except for "Takase-gawa River Ichi no Funairi cove," which has been designated as a historic site.
(Today the entire canal has beenreclaimed except for "Takase-gawa River Ichi no Funairi cove," which has been designated as a historic site.
(Today the all the Funairi has been reclaimed except for 'Takase-gawa River Ichi no Funairi cove,' which has been designated as a historic site.

sen.j: 七条には「内浜」（うちはま）とよばれる船溜まりがあった。
sen.e: A berth called "Uchihama" was located near Shichijo.
A berth called "Uchihama" was located near Shichijo.
A berth called 'Uchihama' was located near Shichijo.

sen.j: （場所は現在の七条河原町を中心とした七条通の北側である。）
sen.e: A berth was located north of the Shichijo-dori centering on Nanajo Kawaramachi.
The berth was located north of the Shichijo-dori centered on Nanajo Kawaramachi.
(The berth was located north of the Shichijo-dori Street centered on Nanajo Kawaramachi.)
sen.cmt: 括弧, Street を追加しました。

sen.j: 内浜の設置は、慶安元年（1648年）からの枳殻邸（渉成園）の建設などに合わせて、御土居の付け替え、高瀬川の流路の変更とともに行われた。
sen.e: The building of the Uchihama was in time with the construction of Kikoku-tei House (Syosei-en Garden), coinciding with replacement of Odoi earthen walls and flow change of the Takase-gawa River

Uchihama was built during the construction of Kikoku-tei House (Syosei-en Garden), which conincided with the replacement of the Odoi earthen walls, as well as change in the flow of the Takase-gawa River

Uchihama was built during the construction of Kikoku-tei House (Shosei-en Garden) that started from 1648, which coincided with the replacement of the Odoi earthen walls, as well as change in the flow of the Takase-gawa River.
sen.cmt: ピリオド、年号を追加しました。スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 内浜の名は御土居の内側に位置したことに由来する。
sen.e: The Uchihama was named after its location-- being inside the Odoi earthen walls.
The Uchihama was named after its location-- being inside the Odoi earthen walls.
The Uchihama was named after its location-- being inside the Odoi earthen walls.

sen.j: 川沿いには、曳子（舟曳き人夫）が高瀬舟を人力で曳いて歩くための曳舟道が設けられた。
sen.e: Hikifunemichi (Towpath) was provided along the river so that Hikiko (boat pullers) can walk pulling a Takasebune boat manually.
Hikifunemichi (Towpath) was provided along the river so that Hikiko (boat pullers) could walk and manually pull a Takasebune boat along the river.
Hikifunemichi (Towpath) was provided along the river so that Hikiko (boat pullers) could walk and manually pull a Takasebune boat along the river.

sen.j: 江戸時代を通じて、京都と伏見とを結ぶ主要な物流手段として多くの舟が行き交っていた。
sen.e: During the Edo Period, many boats were found travelling as an important means of distribution that linked Kyoto and Fushimi..
During the Edo Period, many boats were used as an important means of distribution that linked Kyoto and Fushimi..
During the Edo period, many boats were used as an important means of distribution that linked Kyoto and Fushimi.
sen.cmt: period 小文字にしました。不要なピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: 明治時代に入り、明治27年（1894年）に琵琶湖疏水（鴨川運河）が通じると、輸送物資の役割分担によって共存を図ろうとしたものの物資輸送量は減少し、大正9年（1920年）に水運は廃止されることになった。
sen.e: In the Meiji Period, after Lake Biwa Canal (Kamogawa Canal) opened in 1894, the volume of goods transpoted through Takase-gawa River declined despite efforts to share the function of transporting goods with Lake Biwa Canal, and finally water transportation through the Takase-gawa River came to an end in 1920.

In the Meiji Period, after Lake Biwa Canal (Kamogawa Canal) opened in 1894, the volume of goods transpoted through Takase-gawa River declined despite efforts to share the River's transportation capabilities with Lake Biwa Canal, and transportation through the Takase-gawa River came to an end in 1920.

In the Meiji period, after Lake Biwa Canal (Kamogawa Canal) opened in 1894, the volume of goods transported through Takase-gawa River declined despite efforts to share the River's transportation capabilities with Lake Biwa Canal, and transportation through the Takase-gawa River came to an end in 1920.
sen.cmt: period 小文字にしました。スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: また、この頃に高瀬川を暗渠化し、京都市電を拡幅する都市計画道路が検討されたが、地元住民の反対により、河原町通に変更された。
sen.e: Also, around that tinm, the construction of a city planning road was proposed to cover the Takase-gawa River and widen a lane of the Kyoto City Trams, but the lane was instead laid out on the Kawaramachi-dori because of a residents' oppositions.

Around this time, the construction of a city planned road was proposed to cover the Takase-gawa River in order to widen a lane of the Kyoto City Trams, but the lane was instead laid out on the Kawaramachi-dori due to opposition from residents.

Around this time, the construction of a city planned road was proposed to cover the Takase-gawa River in order to widen a lane of the Kyoto City Trams, but the lane was instead laid out on the Kawaramachi-dori Street due to opposition from residents.

sen.j: 昭和10年（1935年）に起きた大洪水のあと、鴨川の河川改修の一環として鴨川の川底の浚渫が行われ、鴨川の水位が低下した。
sen.e: After a flood occurred in 1935, the river was dredged as part of a river improvement project and thereby the water level of the river. fell.
After a flood occurred in 1935, the river was dredged as part of a river improvement project causing the water level to fall.
After a heavy flood occurred in 1935, the Kamo-gawa River was dredged as part of a river improvement project causing the water level to fall.

sen.j: そのため、高瀬川が北から鴨川に流入する地点は十条通付近まで移され、また一方で鴨川横断点の下流方向では鴨川からの取水が不可能となり、高瀬川は分断されることとなった。
sen.e: As the result, the junction at which the Takase-gawa River flows into the Kamo-gawa River from the north was relocated to an area near the Jujo-dori, on the other hand. in an downstream area where the Takase-gawa crossed the Kamo-gawa river, water became difficu,lt to take from the Kamo-gawa River; as the result the Takase-gawa River was divided.

As a result, the junction at which the Takase-gawa River flows into the Kamo-gawa River from the north was relocated to an area near the Jujo-dori. On the other hand in a downstream area where the Takase-gawa crossed the Kamo-gawa river, it became difficult to carry out water intake from the Kamo-gawa River; as a result the Takase-gawa River was divided.

As a result, the junction at which the Takase-gawa River flows into the Kamo-gawa River from the north was relocated to an area near the Jujo-dori Street; on the other hand in a downstream area where the Takase-gawa crossed the Kamo-gawa river, it became difficult to carry out water intake from the Kamo-gawa River; as a result the Takase-gawa River was divided.

sen.j: 現在は、二条から五条に掛けて並行する木屋町通に飲食店が多く立地する。
sen.e: Today there are many eating establishments along the Kiyamachi-dori Street in the area from Nijo to Gojo, with which the Takase-gawa River runs in parallel.
Today there are many food establishments along the Kiyamachi-dori Street in the area from Nijo to Gojo, where the Takase-gawa River runs in parallel.
Today there are many food establishments along the Kiyamachi-dori Street in the area from Nijo to Gojo, where the Takase-gawa River runs in parallel.

sen.j: 特に三条から四条あたりにかけては京都の歓楽街の一つとなっており、週末は夜遅くまで賑わっている。
sen.e: In particular, the area between Sanjo and Shijo is one of Kyoto's amusement area which is alive with people until late at night on weekends.
In particular, the area between Sanjo and Shijo is one of Kyoto's amusement areas, and alive with people until late at night on weekends.
In particular, the area between Sanjo and Shijo is one of Kyoto's amusement areas, and alive with people until late at night on weekends.

sen.j: また、幕末の事変を示す石碑が多く、サクラの名所ともなり観光客も多い。
sen.e: The area has many stone monuments showing events that occurred during the end of Edo Period and, in addition, attracts many tourists as a famous cherry blossom viewing spot.
The area has many stone monuments showing events that occurred during the end of Edo Period and in addition, attracts many tourists as a famous cherry blossom viewing spot.
The area has many stone monuments showing events that occurred during the end of the Edo period and in addition, attracts many tourists as a famous cherry blossom viewing spot.
sen.cmt: period 小文字にしました。"the" を挿入しました。

sen.j: 高瀬川と高瀬舟は、森鴎外、吉川英治をはじめ、小説の題材にもしばしば登場する。
sen.e: The Takase-gawa River and Takasebune boats often appear as a theme for novels including those of Ogai MORI and Eiji YOSHIKAWA.
The Takase-gawa River and Takasebune boats often appear in novels by Ogai MORI and Eiji YOSHIKAWA.
The Takase-gawa River and Takasebune boats often appear in novels by authors including Ogai MORI and Eiji YOSHIKAWA.
